articles.title: Fly me to the moon: Japanese billionaire Maezawa seeks girlfriend for SpaceX voyage
articles.description: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa's search for a girlfriend to join him on a voyage around the moon will be the subject of a new documentary program, in the latest attention-grabbing stunt by the entrepreneur.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Kipruto sets 10km road world record in Valencia
articles.description: Kenya's Rhonex Kipruto set a new 10km road world record as compatriot Sheila Chepkirui won the women's race at the 10K Valencia Ibercaja in Spain on Sunday.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Kenya’s Rhonex Kipruto set a new 10km road world record as compatriot Sheila Chepkirui won the women’s race at the 10K Valencia Ibercaja in Spain on Sunday. 
World 10,000m bronze medallist Kipruto clocked 26 minutes 24 seconds to shave 14 seconds… [+1136 chars]

articles.title: Lebanon central bank seeks extra powers, wants controls standardized
articles.description: Lebanon's central bank is seeking extra powers to regulate and standardize controls which commercial banks are imposing on depositors, the governor said on Sunday, saying his intention was to ensure "fair relationships" between banks and customers.

articles.title: Restive Philippine volcano prompts evacuation of thousands of residents
articles.description: A volcano south of the Philippine capital Manila spewed a giant ash plume accompanied by rumbling sounds and tremors on Sunday, prompting authorities to raise the alert level and order the evacuation of about 8,000 residents.
articles.content:

articles.title: Hong Kong protesters fete landslide election win for Taiwan's Tsai

articles.title: Williams breaks three-year title drought to win in Auckland
articles.description: Serena Williams won her first title since the 2017 Australian Open with a 6-3 6-4 victory over Jessica Pegula at the Auckland Classic on Sunday but was unable to complete the perfect week in New Zealand when she lost the doubles final.

articles.title: Root misses England training with stomach bug
articles.description: England captain Joe Root did not train on Sunday after being laid low by a stomach bug, a potential blow to the tourists with the third test against South Africa starting at St George's Park on Thursday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Pliskova outlasts Keys for third Brisbane title
articles.description: Defending champion Karolina Pliskova prevailed in a three-set tug-of-war with Madison Keys to become the first three-time winner at the Brisbane International on Sunday.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Defending champion Karolina Pliskova prevailed in a three-set tug-of-war with Madison Keys to become the first three-time winner at the Brisbane International on Sunday.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinea to add 20,000 bpd of oil production this year
articles.description: Equatorial Guinea will add 20,000 barrels per day (bpd) of oil production by October, the country's oil minister said on Sunday.
articles.content:
ABU DHABI (Reuters) - Equatorial Guinea will add 20,000 barrels per day (bpd) of oil production by October, the country’s oil minister said on Sunday.
